title: Media heiress Francesca Packer-Barham buys level-40 penthouse in Darlinghurst’s Horizon
text:
The visiting 25-year-old media heiress Francesca Packer-Barham — reportedly “back to see my mamma” — has bought the level-40 penthouse in Darlinghurst’s Horizon, which exchanged last night.

The whole-floor apartment in the iconic Harry-Seidler-designed block passed in on a vendor bid of $16 million at Saturday’s private auction. Damien Cooley had been the auctioneer and there’d been two registered parties, but neither bid.

RELATED:

Horizon penthouse passes in on $16m vendor bid

Inside the $20m Horizon penthouse

It’s understood she’s paid about $16 million for the five-bedroom, five-bathroom apartment with an eight-car garage,

The Knight Frank lead agent, Adam Ross, with colleague Oliver Stillman, confirmed to the Wentworth Courier this morning only that the property had sold.

MORE: Macquarie exec lists Dover Heights dream home

Heidi Onisforou’s Potts Point buyer revealed

But bound by a confidentiality agreement, he certainly wasn’t providing any information on the buyer or even the final price.

“All I can say is that the campaign drew domestic and international interest and the ultimate party was one of our original seven contract holders,” Mr Ross said.

He also confirmed that the buyer was a local.

However, five days is a long time in top-end eastern suburbs property circles — especially one involving a Packer, who is incredibly excited about her purchase.

She told Nine Media gossip columnist Andrew Hornery that she was “back to see my mamma” when he ran into her in Paddington last Monday. But she also had a significant property purchase on her mind.

The Wentworth Courier understands that Ms Packer-Barham had in fact tried to purchase the penthouse — the biggest single-level apartment in Sydney with 565 sqm of internal space and 710 sqm when the balconies and garage are included — last Friday ahead of the auction.

She’d made an offer of $15.5 million, but the vendors, the Melbourne-based Graham family, had opted to proceed with the auction.

The guide had been $16.5 million.

If it had sold at auction, it would have easily been the most expensive apartment sold at auction.

This certainly isn’t a first home for the 25-year-old. Ms Packer Barham sold her investment property in Melbourne’s South Yarra for $7.6 million in 2017 before heading back to London to complete her final year of design school.

The daughter of billionaire Gretel ­Packer and English financier Nicholas Barham had bought it for $6,125,000 in 2015 when she was dating a Melbourne property developer.

She also owns a two-bedroom apartment in the Encore building in Elizabeth Bay that she bought for $2.1 million in 2016.

Earlier this year, Gretel Packer had offered more than $22m to buy two neighbouring penthouses to create a super penthouse atop Potts Point’s Omnia building, but missed out.

RELATED:

Gretel Packer’s $22m+ offer

Gretel Packer bought the Macleay Regis penthouse for $8.75 million at auction two years ago, though she resides in the Edwardian home ‘Winston’ in Bellevue Hill, next door to the Rona estate, that she bought in 2000 for $11.25m.

It’s easy to see why Ms Packer-Barham, who is keen to be an interior designer, would be impressed with the apartment fit-out.

The incredible property was redesigned by Melbourne-based Mim Design before it hit the market in February with a $20 million price guide in an expression of interest campaign.

At the time, the Wentworth Courier was given exclusive access to the property, with Mr Ross pointing out “It’s the only brand new whole-floor apartment at this price point.”

Although there was considerable interest, it’s taken an auction campaign to get the sale across the line.

The Grahams had bought the Horizon empty shell across two titles for $9.83 million a year ago.

Mim Design says their vision was to pay homage to Harry Seidler (he designed the famous tower) with “asymmetric curving”.

They also wanted to establish clear lines of vision to the harbour and city views.

There’s cote d’azure marble, French oak herringbone parquetry, designer lighting and bespoke joinery with leather accents.

Developer Bob Ell once owned it. It was always expected to sell to a jetsetting couple or even a wealthy eastern suburbs family. But it will certainly make an impressive Sydney base for Ms Packer-Barham and the Packer family.

The eldest grandchild of Kerry Packer has been spending considerable time at the Packer family’s luxury property Ellerston in the Hunter Valley of late.

RELATED:

Point Piper home with $60m price guide set for auction

Mr Cooley is also the auctioneer for a Point Piper house at 1 Wingadal Pl, which is set to go to auction on November 23 and could break the auction record.

He is the same auctioneer who set the current auction record of $23 million in 2009 when Bellevue Hill’s grand Georgian house Le Manoir sold to Lachlan Murdoch.
description: Visiting 25-year-old media heiress Francesca Packer-Barham — reportedly “back to see my mamma” — has shelled out an eye-catching amount on a level-40 penthouse.
